page.title: 02CHERRY LODGE FARM.
page.content: Cherry Lodge Farm has on it the Parsonage Down National Nature Reserve. The Reserve is 276 hectares in size and was made to preserve the chalk downland and breed Longhorn cattle and sheep. On the Reserve there is a wide variety of wildlife. There are 20 different types of butterfly living on Cherry Lodge farm. One of the most interesting is the common blue butterfly. There are up to 42 different plants in a square metre. There are some fairly rare plants that grow such as dwarf thistle, field fleawort, downy oat grass, crested dog'stail,green winged orchid, dwarf sedge, frog orchid, chalk milkwort, early gentian, burnt orchid and spiny restharrow. Many types of bird breed on the farm including the linnet, yellowhammer, spotted flycatcher and skylark.
